title: First State National Historical Park: Volunteer
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Volunteer            Volunteer         Volunteers at First State National Historical Park help remove trash and debris from the Brandywine River at the bi-annual Stream Clean Up.    Volunteer at First State National Historical Park! Explore, learn, and share you time and talent while helping the First State's first national park! We have a variety of volunteer opportunities for individuals and groups, including many that do not require training. How to apply for a Volunteers-In-Park (VIP) Position at First State NHP: All of our current volunteer opportunities, with respective position descriptions, are available on Volunteer.Gov; just type "First State National Historical Park" in the keywords search box. You can also email the Volunteer Program Coordinator to learn more about the big, park-wide, annual events at the seven sites. If you have any special skills or experience, please be sure to include them in your email!  Hot VIP Opportunities: Fort Christina Ribbon Cutting and Service Project: Help us clean up East 7th Street, along Old Swedes Church, Fort Christina Park, and the Kalmar Nyckel on July 19th.
